attr.pathogenesis: mucosal infiltration of neutrophils and epithelial disruption and ulceration

reference: Colitis in Small Animals - Digestive System - Merck Veterinary Manual - https://www.merckvetmanual.com/digestive-system/diseases-of-the-large-intestine-in-small-animals/colitis-in-small-animals

attr.pathogenesis: mucosal infiltration of plasma cells and lymphocytes, fibrosis, and sometimes ulceration

reference: Colitis in Small Animals - Digestive System - Merck Veterinary Manual - https://www.merckvetmanual.com/digestive-system/diseases-of-the-large-intestine-in-small-animals/colitis-in-small-animals

attr.pathogenesis: granulomatous infiltration and bacterial invasion of the colonic wall

reference: Colitis in Small Animals - Digestive System - Merck Veterinary Manual - https://www.merckvetmanual.com/digestive-system/diseases-of-the-large-intestine-in-small-animals/colitis-in-small-animals

attr.breed: all breeds, Boxers and French Bulldogs for granulomatous colitis
attr.age group: middle-aged, under 4 years for granulomatous colitis

reference: Colitis in Small Animals - Digestive System - Merck Veterinary Manual - https://www.merckvetmanual.com/digestive-system/diseases-of-the-large-intestine-in-small-animals/colitis-in-small-animals
